alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 11:42PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 1215 AM MDT... At 1141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boyero, or 27 miles south of Flagler, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse and Aroya. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
